newsitem.title: CANADA: Alberta grain production seen rising, canola lower.
newsitem.headline: Alberta grain production seen rising, canola lower.

text.p: Alberta wheat, barley and oats production should rise this year while canola output is likely to fall, Alberta Agriculture said in its first preliminary crop forecasts for the province.

Spring wheat production was put at 7.66 million tonnes, up from 6.41 million a year earlier, and barley output was pegged at 7.96 million, up from 6.34 million, it said in a crop update based on conditions as of August 20.
Alberta's oats production was seen soaring to 1.37 million tonnes from 771,000 tonnes but canola output was forecast to fall to 1.94 million from 2.43 million.
The report said canola was seven percent swathed and two percent combined and was rated 64 percent good to excellent. Year ago comparisons were not available.
Barley was five percent swathed but less than two percent combined and rated 67 percent good to excellent.
Oats, flax and spring wheat were all less than two percent swathed and combined. Oats were 79 percent good to excellent, flax 82 percent and wheat 76 percent.
"Most crop yields appear average to above average this year and crop development ranges from almost on time to two weeks behind normal," the report said.
